Node.gloss: to (cause to) turn back|to cause to cease|to avert|to revoke
Node.definition: literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
literally, a word of pain; therefore = communication that is cruel and that causes emotional pain or anguish
literally: to cause to come up; hence: = causative process by which an activity is caused to increase in intensity
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to make good; hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain activity to take place with enhanced intensity and quality
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= state in which humans are willing to undergo a process
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

Node.gloss: to be, become astute|to be, become clever|to be, become crafty|to be, become cunning|prudence
Node.definition: = state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= objects that are considered valuable to have
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= state of misfortune and distress
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action by which humans cause certain information to reach others
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= abode of the dead; ≈ seen as a place extremely remote from the activities of everyday life but still accessible to God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: to make (one's) face good; hence: = action by which humans give expression to their happiness by pulling a cheerful face
= a physical or emotional state of discomfort or anguish
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: a broken spirit; hence: = a state in which someone's inner person has been deeply affected by grief, the impact of which is compared an object that has been crushed into small pieces
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

literally: to graze; hence: = action by which humans are
actively looking for a certain activity to engage in, ◄ as an animal is looking for food
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= small quantity of objects or substance
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= place(s) where one's valuable goods are store
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= a quantity of food that a person receives to live on for a specific period of time
= (mostly) green plants ► used for food
= affection between people, or between people and deities
= to cause an animal to be fat ◄ by giving it special food ► so that it can be slaughtered and eaten; ≈ fat food was highly appreciated
hatred (between siblings)
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= causative action by which humans provoke other humans to anger and so cause conflicts
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
literally: long of nostrils, long of breath; hence: = pertaining to not being given to anger
literally: long of nostrils; hence: = ability to restrain oneself from expressing one's displeasure; ≈ regarded as wisdom
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to refrain from acting

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a hedge of thorns, thistles, briers; ≈ regarded as an obstacle
= plant with thorns; ≈ regarded as useless; symbol of hardship
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= a road that has been created by covering the surface of the ground with thick layers of sand; ≈ associated with ease of access
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to despise|to disdain|to scorn|to consider (something) beneath (oneself)
Node.definition: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to make straight (an event) > to (perform an event) right
Node.definition: literally: to make straight; = causative action by which humans cause an action to be performed in a morally and ethically acceptable way
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a decision or advice of a group of persons, often secret and sometimes harmful to another
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which deities come to a formal and authoritative decision about something and enforce it
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= state in which events are free from anything that would detract from their quality
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= state in which conditions and circumstances have qualities that inspire appreciation
= causative action by which humans or deities bring misfortune and distress on human ◄ by one's behavior, whether or not intentionally
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= pattern of actions by which someone makes an effort to get personal gain; ≈ with a negative connotation, of unjust gain
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= object given to someone else

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= action by which humans speak softly for themselves as if thinking out loud
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= object that produces or reflects light

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= causative process by which an event causes the human body to accumulate fat, which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well being
literally: (one's) bones, extended to denote the entire person; hence: = a reference to one's self
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans, animals, or objects stay in a certain place for an indefinite amount of time

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
